intro: Discostegia alata, commonly known as the winged discostegia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive wing-like structures on its stems, which give it its common name. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and numerous stamens. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded undergrowth.
